intro: Capurodendron tampinense var. analamazaotrense, commonly known as the Madagascar starwood, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants such as cashews and mangoes. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and distinctive, star-shaped leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, spiny fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
